greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of (1+phi)-divisors of n.
comment: d is called a (1+phi)-divisor of a number n with prime factorization n = Product p(i)^r(i) if d|n and d = Product p(i)^s(i), where s(i)=0 or GCD(s(i),r(i))=1.
a(n) is odd iff n is a 3-full number (cf. A036966).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := EulerPhi[e] + 1; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ ( f @@@ FactorInteger[n] ); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 30 2019*)
program: a061389 = product . map ((+ 1) . a000010 . fromIntegral) . a124010_row
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 29 2001
